result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

dated 10-12-2022 from Atty. Anna Kees, requesting to adjourn the 10-13-2022 Plea and Sentencing Hearing;  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-12-2022:  granted - okay to reset as requested.

9:33 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Kristi Gordan in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Griffis for attorney Anna M Kees in court for Alacia J Weed. 
Defendant Alacia J Weed in court by zoom.
Attorney Griffis requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:16 AM Defendant Alacia J Weed in court with Public Defender Intern Patrick Sicula for Attorney Anna M Kees.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:36 PM Defendant Alacia J Weed in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
